definition: to wish/to express good wishes/to pray/(old) wizard
to congratulate beforehand/to offer best wishes for
The Butterfly Lovers, Chinese folktale/abbr. for 梁山伯與祝英台|梁山伯与祝英台[Liang2 Shan1 bo2 yu3 Zhu4 Ying1 tai2]
to offer birthday congratulations (to an elderly person)
to congratulate respectfully/to wish good luck and success (esp. to a superior)/with best wishes (in writing)
Tianzhu Tibetan autonomous county in Wuwei 武威[Wu3 wei1], Gansu
acolyte in charge of incense in a temple

sentences.english: On the way home, several passersby wished me well.
sentences.chinese: 回去的路上，几个路过的人祝我好运。

sentences.english: Yes. Happy Independence Day to you.
The most common toast with beer is 'Prost! '('good health').
sentences.chinese: 最常见的祝酒词是祝你身体健康。

sentences.english: I' ll drink his health in honour of its being Christmas Day.
sentences.chinese: 总而言之，城里人喝酒时都举杯祝她健康。

sentences.english: I want to send you an old man, I wish you peace in the family the most favorable auspices.
sentences.chinese: 我要送你一个老人，祝你家庭和睦大吉大利。

sentences.english: Good luck, let's hope he is not afraid of hitchhikers.
sentences.chinese: 祝你走运，但愿他不害怕路人搭车。

sentences.english: With regards to his legal battle with Datuk Seri Tiong, I can only wish him good luck.
sentences.chinese: 至于和张庆信的交战，我唯有祝他好运。

sentences.english: And wish our dear Jacky Xue good luck and great success in the coming New Year.
sentences.chinese: 也祝亲爱的谦谦好运常在，并取得更大的成就。

sentences.english: I wish you a pleasant trip on behalf of my company and in my own name.
sentences.chinese: 我代表公司并以我自己的名义祝你旅途愉快。

sentences.english: There are many theories of the origin of this superstition of wishing luck to the actors, but here are a few
sentences.chinese: 关于祝演员好运带来不吉的迷信的起源有很多说法。

sentences.english: For the other people's happiness let a way, don't is also a very happy affair.
sentences.chinese: 不也是很幸福的一件事情祝天下的有情人终成眷属。

sentences.english: Finally, I wish you all good luck and success in your career.
sentences.chinese: 在此，我谨祝各位日后工作顺利，前程锦绣。

sentences.english: May good fortune find you this year.
sentences.chinese: 祝你今年财运亨通，财源不断。

sentences.english: To conclude, I wish you every success in your work, happiness for you and your families, and good luck in everything.
sentences.chinese: 最后，祝大家工作顺利，阖家幸福，万事如意。

sentences.english: At this time of my parting, wish me good luck, my friends!
sentences.chinese: 在我动身的时候，祝我吉祥如意吧，我的朋友们。

definition: to congratulate beforehand/to offer best wishes for
to have all one's wishes (idiom)/best wishes/all the best/may all your hopes be fulfilled
to congratulate respectfully/to wish good luck and success (esp. to a superior)/with best wishes (in writing)
to have one's wishes come true/wish you the best!
to have a pleasant journey/Bon voyage!
lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
Get well soon!/to recover health quickly
